definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Slow down - the car is more stable at lower speeds.
sentences.chinese: 牛津街的车辆来往在高峰时就得减速慢行。

sentences.english: Oh, she walks slowly, across a young man's room…
sentences.chinese: 噢，她缓慢行走，穿过一个年轻人的房间。

sentences.english: The police officer told the driver to slow down.
The old man was walking slowly along the path, his dog following behind.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人在小道上缓慢行走，他的狗跟随其后。

sentences.english: Cars sailed along the empty streets.
sentences.chinese: 车子在空旷的大街上慢行。

sentences.english: Everything is blurred by the fog on the highway, please slow down.
sentences.chinese: 高速公路上雾蒙蒙的，请你减速慢行。

sentences.english: Traffic in Oxford St was reduced to a crawl during the rush hours.
sentences.chinese: 牛津街的车辆来往在高峰时就得减速慢行。

sentences.english: The department store is in a noisy street.
sentences.chinese: 我们在熙熙攘攘的街道上缓慢行走。

definition: to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
mixed use (e.g. pedestrians and vehicles)/joint operation (e.g. trains and buses)
